16 April 2018

Audio Style Transfer with Rhythmic Constraints

Website accompanying results presented in the paper "Audio Style Transfer with Rhythmic Constraints" for the International Conference on Digital Audio Effects 2018. We present 15 transformation pairs tested with 3 different loss terms L1, L2 and L3 defined in the paper, as well as, several additional AST transformations. In addition, transformations acquired with default parameters from audio style transfer (AST) approaches by Barry et al. (2018), Mital (2017) and Ulyanov et al. (Ulyanov 2016) are included with the results. Inputs A and B refer to terms content and style used by the authors of the compared papers. The results are presented thanks to Trackswitch.js audio player by Werner et al. (2017).

References:
1. Shaun Barry and Youngmoo Kim, “Style transfer for musical audio using multiple time-frequency representations,” 2018, Available at: https://github.com/anonymousiclr2018/Style-Transfer-for-Musical-Audio.
2. Parag K. Mital, “Time domain neural audio style transfer,” 2017, Available at: https://github.com/pkmital/time-domain-neural-audio-style-transfer.
3. Dmitry Ulyanov and Vadim Lebedev, “Audio texture synthesis and style transfer,” 2016, Available at: https://dmitryulyanov.github.io/audio-texture-synthesis-and-style-transfer/.
4. Nils Werner, Stefan Balke, Fabian Stöter, Meinard Müller and Bernd Edler, "Trackswitch.js: A Versatile Web-Based Audio Player for Presenting Scientifc Results," 2017, Available at: https://audiolabs.github.io/trackswitch.js/.
